title: How to write a paragraph about myself - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not easy to write on ourself. Partly because you’ll run out of skin fairly soon. There are parts of yourself you simply can’t reach. I would recommend hiring someone to do it, especially if your writing isn’t very clear. You need to consider what kind of ink or instrument you want to use. Tattooing direct is never advisable, because of revisions or typos. You need to consider the quality of ink, whether you want it to be permanent or not. Beware, ink is never permanent. I’d suggest you use a PC, or paper, and write on that instead. You need to decide which aspects of yourself you want to concentrate on, and organise your thoughts and preparation carefully, being aware at all times of your expected audience. Be honest, avoid trumping yourself up, and there’s no need for false modesty. You are what you are, you have triumphs and defeats. You can demonstrate that you can deal with both, and that you can learn from both. The person who’s reading needs to feel that they know something about you when they finish, otherwise they’ll be disappointed with your writing, and shocked to find that you aren’t the person you described.

A single paragraph? Goodness! That’s not very challenging. If you’re a really private person about your personality and the things you’ve done in your life, you could devote the paragraph to your height, age, hair color, and other very superficial facts. As a homework assignment or part of a college/job application, what they’re probably looking for is for you to identify one characteristic of yourself that you feel best represents you. Is it a love of a particular sport? Then write about why you love that sport and how long you’ve loved it. Is it an accomplishment (such as getting an award for volunteer effort or for a project)? Describe what motivated you to undertake the activity, in what ways that relates to some characteristic of yourself and why you take pride in that accomplishment.

The most important thing when writing about one self is to know who you are, why you are here and what you love to do. I will make myself as an example. Am Omole, T. Tabel, a man with creative innovations and ideals. Always foster creativity in life’s through motivational means for them to reach there full potential and also help others too. I believe that all is possible in the world of no limit. As simple as that, you can qualify yourself and give a summary of who you are. Thanks. I remain Tabel.
